page.title: 11MYTHS AND LEGENDS
page.content: Sightings have been reported on Dibbinsdale Hill of a nun who died in Poulton Hall while travelling to the local nunnery. She supposedly waits by the roadside but vanishes when approached. Another legend concerning Dibbinsdale Hill is about a headless nun. The story runs that the nun was travelling from Birkenhead Priory to Chester Cathedral. She sought shelter in the house of the Lancelyn_Greens. One of them demanded that she surrender her virginity or perish. She refused and was locked away to starve to death. In the last reported sightings she vanished. A cyclist was killed about 35 years ago on Dibbinsdale Hill. Her brakes failed and she rode to her death. Her ghost is said to trace her route to this day.
